body.summary: Emurgo concludes that this governance action is unconstitutional, based on the rationale provided below.
body.rationaleStatement:
This Info action proposes to set the Net Change Limit (NCL) for 2025 at 300 million ADA and for 2026 at 250 million ADA.

Proposal link: 
https://adastat.net/governances/7f320409d9998712ff3a3cdf0c9439e1543f236a3d746766f78f1fdbe1e06bf800

The proposal sets the threshold to pass this NCL at 67%. However, according to the Cardano Constitution, the required threshold for a Net Change Limit is clearly defined as greater than 50% of the active voting stake.

Reference: Cardano Constitution

Section 3: Guardrails and Guidelines on Treasury Withdrawal Actions

Treasury withdrawal actions specify the destination and amount of a number of withdrawals from the Cardano treasury.

GUARDRAILS

TREASURY-01a (x):

 A net change limit for the Cardano treasury's balance per period of time must be agreed by the DReps via an on-chain governance action with a threshold of greater than 50% of the active voting stake.

Based on this constitutional requirement, the appropriate threshold to pass a Net Change Limit should be 50% + 1 lovelace, not 67%.
